availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Hardwick (Hartford, Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Hartford, Ohio County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah F. Hardwick. Father of Clarence Hardwick, Elizabeth Hardwick, Juliett Hardwick, Robert Hardwick, Catharine Hardwick, Annie Hardwick, Charles Hardwick. Merchant in Hartford, Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1860. Enrolled in Company F of the Twelfth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on November 12, 1862. Mustered in as Private in the Twelfth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) on November 24, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, City/District, p. X
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 847.
